intro: Parasenecio hastatus, commonly known as the hairy leaf golden ragwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Parasenecio hastatus is generally not considered invasive and plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
